Articles.Content:
**SBD Dauntless!**

![SPwDIgi.png](http://i.imgur.com/SPwDIgi.png)

(yeah I have to work on that lens flare)

![mwyskDQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/mwyskDQ.png)

lining up for launch

A WWII US naval dive bomber

**Stuff**

Fuel: not a lot

Cruisy speed: up to 100m/s

Parts: 176 (yeah suprised me too actually)

Cost: very high--![Fund_char.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/8/8a/Fund_char.png)180 000--but after all, it is vintage right? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Engine limited to 60% for realism and fuel conservation

Seats 2

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/EqIbH)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://www.dropbox.com/s/tew8qaqtx822zrd/SBD%20Dauntless.craft?dl=1)

**Action Groups**

1: toggle engine

2: toggle dive brakes

Abort: ejection seats

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-15T07:02:35Z" title="05/15/2015 07:02  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 15, 2015</time> by Thingymajigy**
I love seeing WWII planes here. Shouldn't it have a longer range, though? It was used as a scout plane, I think.

> 
> I love seeing WWII planes here. Shouldn't it have a longer range, though? It was used as a scout plane, I think.

Well, depends on the number of fuel tanks you can cram in there ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) These WWII planes are really fun to fly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
